meanings.sent1: The old book in the attic slowly moulders away.
meanings.sent2: If you leave food out for too long, it will eventually moulders.
meanings.sent3: The forgotten sandwich in the lunchbox began to moulders, much to the dismay of its owner.
meanings.sent4: Time moulders memories like a gentle breeze eroding a rock.
meanings.sent5: The abandoned house stood silent, its walls starting to moulders into dust.

meanings.definition: A fungus that grows on organic matter
meanings.sent1: The damp environment in the basement encouraged the growth of moulders.
meanings.sent2: If you leave fruit out for too long, it may develop moulders.
meanings.sent3: The old bread left in the pantry attracted moulders, turning green and fuzzy.
meanings.sent4: The fallen tree in the forest was covered in moulders, breaking down the wood.
meanings.sent5: The compost pile was teeming with moulders, breaking down the organic material.
